answers.answer: You can treat it when you find the cause.

Everyone knows that, but i am really not sure, what could be the cause in the first place.I smoke 5 cigarettes per day and i dont drink.I need further advise on any kind of healthy food which i need to use or anything which i need to stop.Please let me know

Smoking can be a major influence in impotence.  If you do smoke, try to smoke an organic ciggarrete since they do not have the cancer causing pesticide chemicals.  Also, consider taking 2000 mg of vitamin c per day, and possibly some zinc to offset the smoking.Also, limit sugar, alcohol, processed flour, and avoid masturbating to porn.

«i am really not sure, what could be the cause in the first place.»ED is a multifactorial condition. There are many possible causes (anxiety, stress, depression, fatigue, high blood pressure, diabetes, etc) and only a urologist can determine the exact cause of your problem and prescribe you an effective treatment. So, I advise you to go see a urologist and do all the necessary medical tests.

Actually, the erection which i used to have in the morning is not there anymore now. I do have an erection when i indulge in sex with my wife but its hardly for a 50 or 55 sec...Is there any kind of food i should be taking to get my sexual power back.

question: I used to have good erection just couple of weeks ago but now i m unable to get that erection. I am getting the erection but then it stays for approximately 1 min and then i loose it before i can start having sex with my wife.I also go to gym but not regularly.Is there any thing more i can do to get this solved.I am married and i m 26 yrs.
title: Not able to erect for long
